alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 10:29AM PST until December 06 at 3:28PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County. Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. Skykomish River Near Gold Bar affecting Snohomish County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County. Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County. .Heavy rain is over but flood waters continue to make their way down rivers and streams. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Skykomish River near Gold Bar. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river fell below flood stage this morning and is expected to continue to fall. Flooding will continue until the flood wave has passed downstream out of the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1245 PM PST.
